org.apache.spark.broadcast

Class HttpBroadcast<T>

  • Object
    • org.apache.spark.broadcast.Broadcast<T>
      • org.apache.spark.broadcast.HttpBroadcast<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Logging

    public class HttpBroadcast<T>
extends Broadcast<T>
implements Logging, scala.Serializable
    A Broadcast implementation that uses HTTP server as a broadcast mechanism. The first time a HTTP broadcast variable (sent as part of a task) is deserialized in the executor, the broadcasted data is fetched from the driver (through a HTTP server running at the driver) and stored in the BlockManager of the executor to speed up future accesses.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • unpersist

        public static void unpersist(long id,
             boolean removeFromDriver,
             boolean blocking)
        Remove all persisted blocks associated with this HTTP broadcast on the executors. If removeFromDriver is true, also remove these persisted blocks on the driver and delete the associated broadcast file.
